bibl.title: Jow Mun Fuey v. Luther Weedin. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Jow Mun Fuey for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Comes now Jow Mun Fuey, both in person and by his attorneys, Daniel Landon and Paul W. Houser, and respectfully makes this application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, and alleges as follows:

That said Jow Mun Fuey a of United States is in prison and restrained of his liberty by the United States Commissioner of Immigration Luther Weedin, and the United States Chinese Inspector M. C. Farris, or by some person or persons acting through, by, or under them at the Detention House at the Immigration Station in the City of Seattle, under the charge that the said Jow Mun Fuey has no legal right to be in the United States, and that he should be deported, and your petitioner respectfully informes this Honorable Court that said imprisonment and restraint and order of deportation is illegal and not according to law.
WHEREFORE Your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be issued to said Jow Mun Fuey and that your petitioner may be discharged from such illegal restraint.
UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION

Jow Mun Fuey being first duly sworn on oath, deposes and says that he is the petitioner herein and has heard read the foregoing petition and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true of his knowledge, and that he believes said facts to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 5th day of January, 1922.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle
Filed in the United States District Court
